p: Approximately 300 Sitophilus granarius ( S. granarius) insects, the wheat grain weevil, were reared in 1 L glass jars containing sterilized wheat grains, without exposure to insecticides. The cultures were maintained in the dark at 28 ± 2 °C and 70 ± 5% relative humidity. Adults of 1–7 days old were used throughout the experiments in the same conditions.
